pages.text: Their recompense, in their Lord‘s presence, shall be the Gardens of Eden, watered by running brooks, wherein shall they abide for ever. God is well pleased with them, and they are well pleased with Him. Thus shall the God-fearing be rewarded
WHEN EARTH is rocked in her last convulsion
when Earth shakes off her burdens
and Man says, ‘What may this mean?‘ ―
on that day she will proclaim her tidings
for your Lord will have inspired her
On that day mankind will come out in broken bands to be shown their labours
Whoever did an atom‘s weight of good shall see it
and whoever did an atom‘s weight of evil shall also see it
which strike fire with their hoofs
as they gallop to the raid at morn
and with a trail of dust
Man is ungrateful to his Lord
To this he himself shall bear witness
He loves riches with all his heart
But is he not aware that when the dead are thrown out from their graves
